title: Peter Thomas (footballer, born 1944)
text:
Peter Thomas (born 20 November 1944) was a <a href="Association%20football">football</a> <a href="striker%20%28football%29">goalkeeper</a> who played in England, Ireland and U.S.A.
Player.
Professional.
In 1962, Thomas joined Coventry G.E.C., playing with them until 1966. That year, he played one game for <a href="Coventry%20City%20F.C.">Coventry City</a>. He went on loan to <a href="Waterford%20F.C.">Waterford F.C.</a> in 1967 where he made thirteen appearances. Coventry City transferred him to Waterford in the summer of 1967 and he stayed with the Blues until 1975. Thomas is associated with bringing a new style of goalkeeping to the League of Ireland. He rarely kicked the ball on the offensive, throwing when possible with great accuracy. He also represented the <a href="League%20of%20Ireland%20XI">League of Ireland XI</a> and won five league medals and a <a href="FAI%20Cup">FAI Cup</a> medal and played in 12 European Cup matches for Waterford.
In 1975, he moved to the United States where he played for the <a href="Washington%20Diplomats">Washington Diplomats</a> of the <a href="North%20American%20Soccer%20League%20%281968%E2%80%931984%29">North American Soccer League</a>. In 1976, he moved to the <a href="Utah%20Golden%20Spikers">Utah Golden Spikers</a> of the <a href="American%20Soccer%20League%20%281933-1983%29">American Soccer League</a>. He returned to the NASL in 1977 with the <a href="Las%20Vegas%20Quicksilvers">Las Vegas Quicksilvers</a>. The Diplomats had traded the rights to Thomas and <a href="Gerry%20Ingram">Gerry Ingram</a> to the Quicksilver in exchange for <a href="Peter%20Silvester%20%28footballer%29">Peter Silvester</a> in November 1976. He finished his North American career with the <a href="Sacramento%20Gold%20%281976%E2%80%931980%29">Sacramento Gold</a> of the ASL in 1978. In the fall of 1978, he returned to Ireland where he rejoined <a href="Waterford%20F.C.">Waterford F.C.</a>
National team.
Born in England, Thomas earned two <a href="cap%20%28sports%29">caps</a> with the <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland%20national%20football%20team">Republic of Ireland</a> after becoming an Irish citizen. He made his debut in 1973 against <a href="Poland%20national%20football%20team">Poland</a>, keeping a clean sheet but having to come off at half time due to a pulled muscle in his stomach. His second cap came against <a href="Brazil%20national%20football%20team">Brazil</a> in 1974. He was back down in the ASL in 1975, this time with the <a href="Sacramento%20Gold%20%281976%E2%80%931980%29">Sacramento Gold</a>.
Manager.
He took over as manager of <a href="Waterford%20United%20F.C.">Waterford United F.C.</a> in August 1988 but resigned in December due to work pressures.
